Functions for diversity estimation from breakaway package

estimateBreakway.Rd

Several functions for calculation of diversity indices implemented by the breakaway package are available via wrapper functions.

estimateBreakaway(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "breakaway", ...)

estimateKemp(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "kemp", ...)

estimateWLRMuntransformed(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "WLRMun", ...)

estimateWLRMtransformed(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "wlrm", ...)

estimatePoissonModel(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "poisson", ...)

estimateChaoBunge(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "chao_bunge", ...)

estimateChao1(x, abund_values = "counts", name = "chao1", ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateBreakaway(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "breakaway",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateKemp(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "kemp",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateWLRMuntransformed(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "WLRMun",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateWLRMtransformed(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "WLRM",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimatePoissonModel(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "poisson",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateChaoBunge(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "chao_bunge",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateChao1(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  name = "chao1",
  BPPARAM = SerialParam(),
  ...
)

Arguments

x

a SummarizedExperiment object
abund_values

the name of the assay used for calculation of the sample-wise estimates
name

a name for the column of the colData the results should be stored in.
...

additional parameters passed to the function implemented by the breakaway package
BPPARAM

A BiocParallelParam object specifying whether calculation of estimates should be parallelized.

Value

x with additional colData named *name* containing the main diversity score and *name*_summary containing a summary DataFrame

Details

Other diversity measures implemented by breakaway are also available, such as Shannon.

See also

  • estimateDiversity

  • breakaway

  • kemp

  • wlrm_transformed

  • wlrm_untransformed

  • chao_bunge

  • poisson_model

  • chao1

Examples

data(GlobalPatterns)
se <- GlobalPatterns

se <- estimateBreakaway(se)
colData(se)$breakaway

#>       CL3       CC1       SV1   M31Fcsw   M11Fcsw   M31Plmr   M11Plmr   F21Plmr 
#> 11148.976 12333.547  8903.633  2947.488  2859.583  3381.793  6388.320  6629.254 
#>   M31Tong   M11Tong  LMEpi24M  SLEpi20M    AQC1cm    AQC4cm    AQC7cm       NP2 
#>  3397.561  2384.911  3883.194 67040.799 14587.146  8444.514 11258.094  2814.465 
#>       NP3       NP5   TRRsed1   TRRsed2   TRRsed3      TS28      TS29     Even1 
#>  4131.281  3787.493  3224.358  5203.099  5012.179  8921.387  2925.795  4673.408 
#>     Even2     Even3 
#>  3595.659 13697.312 
colData(se)$breakaway_summary

#> DataFrame with 26 rows and 6 columns

#> M11Fcsw   2859.58    21.7484       2615.15,4555.83     Poisson      FALSE
#> ...           ...        ...                   ...         ...        ...

#> Even1     4673.41    26.8882       4281.56,7304.66     Poisson      FALSE

se <- estimateWLRMuntransformed(se)
colData(se)$WLRMun

#>      CL3      CC1      SV1  M31Fcsw  M11Fcsw  M31Plmr  M11Plmr  F21Plmr 
#> 20484.26 16042.57 12946.39       NA       NA       NA 11581.99       NA 
#>  M31Tong  M11Tong LMEpi24M SLEpi20M   AQC1cm   AQC4cm   AQC7cm      NP2 
#>       NA       NA       NA 67040.80       NA 22419.20 44553.77       NA 
#>      NP3      NP5  TRRsed1  TRRsed2  TRRsed3     TS28     TS29    Even1 
#>       NA       NA       NA       NA       NA       NA       NA       NA 
#>    Even2    Even3

# plotting the diversities
library(scater)

#> Loading required package: ggplot2
plotColData(se, "breakaway")

# ... by sample type
plotColData(se, "breakaway", "SampleType")
